item.title:
RT by @0xTaker: introducing the lotus router, an optimized, extensible, free and open source router
architecturally, it's an embedded virtual machine in the evm, it treats opcodes as defi protocol calls, and it uses bigbrainchad.eth-like encoding.
ideologically, searcher and solver cartels hoard the cutting edge of router technology. there is no alpha among them, source is closed to snuff out newcomers. but when closed source is status quo, open source is defiance.
as such, the lotus is an educational resource. the lotus is an integration opportunity. the lotus bears the agpl-3 copyleft license.
study it. modify it. use it.
but whatever you do, share it with your fellow peoples.
peace üíú
https://github.com/jtriley2p/lotus-router
item.dc:creator: @jtriley2p
item.description:
introducing the lotus router,
an optimized, extensible, free and open source router

architecturally,
it's an embedded virtual machine in the evm,
it treats opcodes as defi protocol calls, and
it uses bigbrainchad.eth-like encoding.

ideologically,
searcher and solver cartels hoard the cutting edge of router technology.
there is no alpha among them, source is closed to snuff out newcomers.
but when closed source is status quo, open source is defiance.

as such,
the lotus is an educational resource.
the lotus is an integration opportunity.
the lotus bears the agpl-3 copyleft license.

study it.
modify it.
use it.

but whatever you do,
share it with your fellow peoples.

peace üíú

github.com/jtriley2p/lotus-r‚Ä¶

item.title:
RT by @0xTaker: Flashblocks make Base faster
This 10x change makes Base the fastest EVM chain to date, bringing effective block times from 2 seconds down to 200 milliseconds ‚Äîand they're live on testnet right now + coming to mainnet in Q2

item.title:
RT by @0xTaker: 1/ How do solvers like CoWSwap, 1inchFusion, and UniswapX compare with traditional DEXes like Uniswap v2 and v3?

item.title:
If @timedotfun is to advisory like @echodotxyz and @legiondotcc is to capital, has it solved predatorial advisory offers?
We managed to get some good ones prior at @aori_io but know other teams that got fucked on what some VCs promise you vs what they acc can do

item.title: RT by @0xTaker: According to Bloomberg, Citadel Securities, led by Ken Griffin, is planning to become a liquidity provider for cryptocurrencies. The firm aims to join the market maker roster of several exchanges, including Coinbase Global, Binance, and Crypto com, and may initially set up market-making teams outside of the United States. https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-02-24/crypto-citadel-securities-plans-to-trade-digital-coins-on-exchanges?srnd=phx-crypto
item.dc:creator: @WuBlockchain
item.description: According to Bloomberg, Citadel Securities, led by Ken Griffin, is planning to become a liquidity provider for cryptocurrencies. The firm aims to join the market maker roster of several exchanges, including Coinbase Global, Binance, and Crypto com, and may initially set up market-making teams outside of the United States. bloomberg.com/news/articles/‚Ä¶

item.title: RT by @0xTaker: Open-sourcing GasFlow, a system for predicting optimal ethereum priority fees. Uses a RandomForest-based ML model trained on mempool and historical gas data to estimate fees based on network conditions. Completely open-source.
item.dc:creator: @duoxehyon
item.description: Open-sourcing GasFlow, a system for predicting optimal ethereum priority fees. Uses a RandomForest-based ML model trained on mempool and historical gas data to estimate fees based on network conditions. Completely open-source.

item.title: RT by @0xTaker: It‚Äôs almost surreal how much time was spent during the bear market on decentralizing block building and sounding the alarm bells about the ‚Äúexistential risk‚Äù posed by MEV on the L1 and now everyone is just totally fine using a single box, like completely normalized no problem
